programme.title: Ordinary Angels
programme.desc: Drama based on a true story, starring Hilary Swank and Alan Ritchson. A struggling hairdresser in small-town Kentucky finds purpose by putting her energies into helping a widowed father get the funds to provide a liver transplant for his youngest daughter Jon Gunn - Director Hilary Swank - Sharon Stevens Alan Ritchson - Ed Schmitt Emily Mitchell - Michelle Schmitt Nancy Travis - Barbara Schmitt Tamala Jones - Rose Skywalker Hughes - Ashley Schmitt Amy Acker - Theresa Schmitt.

programme.title: The Secret Kingdom
programme.sub-title: Action, Family, Fantasy, Drama, Children's ║ 2023 ║ PG
programme.desc: Peter and his younger sister Verity move into a new house and struggle to acclimatise to their surroundings in an emotionally unsettling period for their family. The children tumble into a cavernous space beneath their bedroom and are greeted by an army of pangolins, who decree Peter their ruler. Fantasy adventure, starring Sam Everingham and Alyla Browne Matt Drummond - Director Sam Everingham - Peter Alyla Browne - Verity Alice Parkinson - Viviane Drawmer Christopher Gabardi - David Drawmer Darius Williams - Pling Beth Champion - Ego.

programme.title: Robin and the Hoods
programme.sub-title: Action, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Drama ║ 2024 ║ PG
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Darcey Ewart and Naomie Harris. Robin is an 11-year-old girl who plays imaginative games with her friends, the Hoods, on the wooded land near to their homes. programme.title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
programme.sub-title: Action, Family, Drama, Animation, Comedy, Fantasy, Children's, Sci Fi ║ 2024 ║ PG
programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. The trio become concerned when the Old Man, who narrates their illustrated existence, suddenly falls silent. Using his magical crayon, Harold draws a door to the real world and tumbles into the present day as a flesh-and-blood man, who collides head-on with widow Terry and her young son, Mel. programme.title: The Bikeriders
programme.desc: Truck driver Johnny is inspired to establish the Vandals motorcycle club in 1960s Chicago. He assembles a motley crew, including Brucie, Benny, Cal and Zipco. Exuberant outsider Kathy falls under Benny's spell, and they marry, but when the groom is the victim of a violent assault, Johnny exacts revenge, while Kathy fights for her husband's tormented soul. programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: Action crime thriller from the director of Heat, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx. Suave hitman Vincent hijacks taxi driver Max and forces him to stop at a variety of locations in Los Angeles where he carries out his gruesome business. programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.sub-title: Romance, Thriller, Drama, Crime/detective, Action, Music ║ 2017 ║ 15
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, Baby, a young getaway driver with tinnitus, takes part in a heist which seems doomed to fail, especially as the characters involved lose touch with reality as events spiral out of control. programme.title: Catch Me If You Can
programme.sub-title: Documentary And Factual, Drama, Crime/detective, Comedy ║ 2002 ║ 12
programme.desc: Comedy drama, based on the true story of conman Frank Abagnale Jr, starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Tom Hanks. Shattered by the news that his parents are divorcing, 16-year-old Frank runs away to New York. programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Federal agent Aaron Falk returns to his drought-stricken home town after an absence of more than 20 years to attend the funeral of his childhood friend. programme.title: Fight or Flight
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Josh Hartnett and Charithra Chandran. programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.sub-title: Documentary And Factual, War, Drama, Action, History ║ 2001 ║ 15
programme.desc: War drama based on real events, starring Josh Hartnett, Ewan McGregor and Tom Sizemore. On 3 October 1993, elite US troops were sent into Somalia's capital, Mogadishu, to capture two lieutenants working for the local warlord responsible for orchestrating a famine in the region. programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. Reporting from the frontline, Miller captures indelible images of the conflict, including the horrors found in the Nazi concentration camps at Buchenwald and Dachau Ellen Kuras - Director Kate Winslet - Lee Miller Andy Samberg - Davy Scherman Alexander Skarsgård - Roland Penrose Marion Cotillard - Solange D'Ayen Andrea Riseborough - Audrey Withers Noémie Merlant - Nusch Eluard Josh O'Connor - Young Man / Antony Penrose James Murray - Colonel Spencer Arinzé Kene - Major Jonesy Vincent Colombe - Paul Eluard.

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: Mystery thriller based on the bestselling novel by Dan Brown, starring Tom Hanks and Audrey Tautou. When the victim of a ritualised killing is discovered at the Louvre, French cryptographer Sophie Neveu and Harvard professor Robert Langdon are called in to try to identify strange symbols cut into the body. programme.title: Angels & Demons
programme.desc: Mystery thriller based on Dan Brown's forerunner to The Da Vinci Code, starring Tom Hanks and Ayelet Zurer. With the election of a new pope imminent, the Illuminati kidnap the four leading contenders and issue a coded message that they will murder the men and blow up the Vatican. Catholic leaders turn to Harvard symbolist Robert Langdon, who must put his uneasy relationship with the church hierarchy aside in an effort to crack the code and save the men's lives Ron Howard - Director Tom Hanks - Robert Langdon Ewan McGregor - Camerlengo Patrick McKenna Ayelet Zurer - Vittoria Vetra Stellan Skarsgård - Commander Richter Pierfrancesco Favino - Inspector Ernesto Olivetti Nikolaj Lie Kaas - Mr Gray / Assassin Armin Mueller-Stahl - Cardinal Strauss Thure Lindhardt - Chartrand David Pasquesi - Claudio Vincenzi Cosimo Fusco - Father Simeon.

programme.title: Inferno
programme.sub-title: Action, Mystery, Thriller, Drama, Crime/detective, Arts And Culture ║ 2016 ║ 12
programme.desc: Mystery thriller based on the bestseller by Dan Brown, starring Tom Hanks and Felicity Jones. Renowned symbologist Dr Robert Langdon wakes up in a Florence hospital with a head injury and no memory of the previous 48 hours. programme.title: Arthur's Whisky
programme.desc: When Joan's husband dies, she discovers he'd invented an anti-aging elixir that literally takes the years off. Sharing it with her friends Linda and Susan, the rejuvenated women waste little time in painting the town red, but they soon realise it's a very different world to the one they remember. programme.sub-title: Fantasy, Drama, Action, Family, Children's, Mystery ║ 2016 ║ PG
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure directed by Steven Spielberg, starring Mark Rylance and Ruby Barnhill. London, 1983: ten-year-old Sophie is awake in the middle of the night when she spots a giant from the window of her orphanage home. Although Sophie hides, the 24ft behemoth grabs her and takes the little girl to Giant Country. programme.title: Fireheart
programme.sub-title: Action, Comedy, Drama, Animation, Family ║ 2022 ║ PG
programme.desc: In 1930, 16-year-old Georgia Nolan dreams of being the world's first-ever female firefighter. When a mysterious arsonist starts burning down Broadway, New York's firemen begin vanishing. Georgia's father is called out of retirement by the Mayor to lead the investigation into the disappearances. Desperate to help her father and save the city, Georgia disguises herself as a young man called Joe and joins a group of misfit firefighters trying to stop the arsonist. programme.desc: Drama based on a true story starring Matthew McConaughey, Jennifer Garner and Jared Leto. programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Biographical comedy drama starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman. In 1980s Washington, charismatic Texas politician Charles Wilson is notorious for his hard-drinking, drug-taking and womanising lifestyle, earning the nickname "Good Time Charlie". But the seemingly carefree congressman is stirred into action when socialite Joanne Herring draws his attention to the plight of the Afghan people suffering under Soviet occupation. A frantic Will engages the local police and Lisa's parents in a desperate attempt to find her, but as time passes and suspicion falls on him, he must take matters into his own hands, delving into the town's criminal underbelly while running from the authorities in a race against time. He hopes that the backyard swimming pool will be fun for the kids and provide physical therapy for himself. However, a dark secret from the home's past soon unleashes a malevolent force that drags the family into the depths of inescapable terror. Writer/director Bryce McGuire's horror, starring Wyatt Russell and Kerry Condon Bryce McGuire - Director Wyatt Russell - Ray Waller Kerry Condon - Eve Waller Amélie Hoeferle - Izzy Waller Gavin Warren - Elliot Waller Nancy Lenehan - Kay.

programme.title: The Ritual
programme.desc: Horror starring Rafe Spall. Four university mates are stalked by evil when they go hiking in Sweden to honour the memory of a friend who was violently murdered. After discovering a cabin in the woods, the group are menaced by a pagan presence in an ordeal that tests their friendships and forces them to come to terms with the past David Bruckner - Director Rafe Spall - Luke Rob James-Collier - Hutch Arsher Ali - Phil Sam Troughton - Dom.

programme.title: Voyagers
programme.sub-title: Thriller, Drama, Sci Fi, Action, Mystery ║ 2021 ║ 15
programme.desc: Thirty young men and women are sent deep into space on a multi-generational mission in search of a new home. The mission descends into madness, as the crew reverts to its most primal state, not knowing if the real threat they face is what's outside the ship or who they're becoming inside it. programme.title: A Different Man
programme.desc: Black comedy drama starring Sebastian Stan, Renate Reinsve and Adam Pearson. Edward, a struggling actor, undergoes a radical medical procedure to remove the tumours growing on his face. programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: Supernatural horror comedy sequel starring Michael Keaton, Winona Ryder and Jenna Ortega. In the decades since narrowly avoiding marriage to the lascivious demon Betelgeuse, Lydia Deetz has found fame as a TV occultist. Her teenage daughter, Astrid, is sceptical and distant, still mourning the death of her father some years before. But then Astrid has her own perilous brush with the beyond - and her despairing mother realises there's only one being who can help her out.. programme.title: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
programme.desc: Comedy starring Gene Wilder and Richard Pryor. A bookie is shot and fatally wounded by a mysterious woman while visiting the news-stand of deaf former actor Dave Lyons and his blind assistant Wally. programme.title: Fletch

programme.title: Book of Love
programme.desc: Young, uptight and unsuccessful English writer Henry's latest novel sells poorly. But when the book suddenly becomes a surprise hit in Mexico, his publicist insists he travel there on a promotional tour. Upon arrival, a confused Henry discovers the reason behind the popularity - Mexican translator Maria has rewritten the dull book as a steamy erotic story. programme.title: 1963 FA Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 25/5/63. Played at a fully roofed Wembley for the first time, Leicester had achieved the double over United in the league, so the Reds went into this game as the underdogs.

programme.title: 1968 European Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 29/5/68. Matt Busby had led his side from the tragedy of Munich to the brink of glory at Wembley, could they beat Benfica and be crowned kings of Europe?

programme.title: 1977 FA Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 21/5/77. FA Cup Final. United were the underdogs and out to spoil Liverpool's chances of a treble.

programme.title: 1983 FA Cup Final Replay
programme.desc: United Archives 21/5/83. Brighton had produced a shock to take the first game to a replay, but Bryan Robson and the lads had other ideas this time around.

programme.title: 1985 FA Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 18/5/85. United take on current holders & league champions Everton in a game remembered for the first player ever to be sent off in a Cup Final and a piece of Norman Whiteside magic.

programme.title: 1990 FA Cup Final Replay
programme.desc: United Archives 17/5/90. Hard to live up to the first meeting between these teams five days earlier, United faced Crystal Palace again aiming to secure Alex Ferguson's first major trophy.

programme.title: 1991 CWC Final: v Barcelona
programme.desc: United Archives 15/5/91. United travel to Feyenoord Stadium in Rotterdam to face Barcelona in the 1991 European Cup Winners Cup Final.

programme.title: 1994 FA Cup Final: v Chelsea
programme.desc: United Archives 14/5/94. United were aiming to become the fourth club in the 20th Century to complete The Double & for the first time in the club's history as they took on Chelsea in the FA Cup final.

programme.title: 1996 FA Cup Final: v Liverpool
programme.desc: United Archives 11/5/96. United were aiming to become the first club to win the FA Cup 9 times in this final against Liverpool and also win the League and Cup double on two occasions.

programme.title: 1999 FA Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 22/5/99. Having already won the league, and with Bayern Munich in Barcelona still to come, this FA Cup Final v Newcastle was the second leg of United's quest to win the Treble.

programme.title: Top 20 Goals at Wembley
programme.desc: Stop scrolling, take 10 minutes out and watch United's top 20 goals at Wembley Stadium.

programme.title: 1999 UCL Final v Bayern Munich
programme.desc: United Archives 26/5/99. An absolute classic, with two trophies in the bag only Bayern Munich stood between United and an unprecedented treble.

programme.title: 2004 FA Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 22/5/04. United were clear favourites to lift the FA Cup when they faced Millwall at the Millennium Stadium in May 2004.

programme.title: 2006 League Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 26/2/06. United hadn't won the League Cup since 1992 but travelled to the Millennium Stadium in Cardiff hopeful of victory over Wigan.

programme.title: 2008 UCL Final: v Chelsea
programme.desc: United Archives 21/5/08. 50 years after Munich, 40 years on from Wembley and 9 years after Barcelona, United take on Chelsea bidding to rule Europe for the third time.

programme.title: 2010 League Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 28/2/10. The final of the 2010 Carling Cup and United hope to retain the trophy they won 12 months earlier as they took on Aston Villa at Wembley.

programme.title: Top 20 Goals at Wembley
programme.desc: Stop scrolling, take 10 minutes out and watch United's top 20 goals at Wembley Stadium.

programme.title: EFL Cup Final v Soton 16/17
programme.desc: United Archives 26/2/17. The Reds were aiming to lift the first domestic silverware up for grabs in the 2016/17 campaign as they walked out at Wembley to face Claude Puel's Southampton side.

programme.title: EL: Ajax Final 16/17
programme.desc: United Archives 24/5/17. The Reds looked to secure the missing piece of major silverware in their trophy cabinet, as they faced Ajax in the Europa League Final in Stockholm.

programme.title: WTA Final: Rome
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the Italian Open, as home favourite and world number five Jasmine Paolini faces the American Coco Gauff. (17.05).

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05).

programme.title: EFL 09/10: Sheff Utd v Sheff Weds
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic clash from the English Football League. Here, Sheffield United and Sheffield Wednesday meet in a thrilling Steel City derby in September 2009.

programme.title: EFL 10/11: Peterborough v So'ton
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic clash from the English Football League. Here, Peterborough and Southampton meet in an eight-goal thriller in League 1 in February 2011.

programme.title: EFL 12/13: Watford v Leicester
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic clash from the English Football League. Here, Watford meet Leicester City in the famous second leg of their Championship play-off semi-final in May 2013.

programme.title: EFL 13/14: Sheff Weds v Leeds Utd
programme.desc: Relive a classic match from the Football League. Here, Yorkshire rivals Sheffield Wednesday and Leeds United meet at Hillsborough in January 2014 in a memorable game for the Owls.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:M City/L'Pool 15
programme.desc: Relive a Premier League classic, as Man City face Liverpool back in November 2015. City needed a win to go back top of the table, while Liverpool were adapting to life under Jurgen Klopp.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:M City/L'Pool 13
programme.desc: Relive a Premier League classic, as Man City face Liverpool back in 2013. City needed three points to close the gap at the top to Man Utd, while the Reds were chasing a top four spot.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Man U/L'Pool '95
programme.desc: A look back at some classic matches in the Premier League. Here, Man United host Liverpool in October 1995, as Eric Cantona returned from his lengthy suspension in a thrilling 2-2 draw.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:L'Pool/Man U '97
programme.desc: A look back at some classic matches in the Premier League. Here, Liverpool meet Manchester United at Anfield in 1997, in a match that had a happy outcome for the Red Devils.

programme.desc: Former and current pros take viewers behind the ropes on the course, discussing such things as shot setup, club selection, and strategy. Here, Aaron Wise delivers the lesson.
